pr_title: Fix #3174 patient encounter form field alignment
pr_body:
<!--
(Thanks for sending a pull request!
-->

<!-- Add the issue number that is fixed by this PR (In the form Fixes #123) -->
Fixes #3174 

#### Short description of what this resolves:
Adjust form field alignment.
Refine button color and add font-awesome icon.
Refactor js syntax, e.g., ```var``` to ```const```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/76861347-69a51b80-6897-11ea-8d1d-bb24f5d504e0.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/76861379-77f33780-6897-11ea-8cd0-27f178a2e922.png)
pr_review_comments: [{'comment_id': 394088492, 'comment_body': 'per recent styling guidelines, lets: 1. use btn-secondary 2. remove btn-cancel and add the cancel icon (from https://github.com/openemr/openemr/blob/master/interface/themes/core/FontAwesome.scss#L29) to the button', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 18, 3, 31, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 394088666, 'comment_body': 'per recent styling guidelines, lets: 1. use btn-secondary 2. remove btn-cancel and add the cancel icon (from https://github.com/openemr/openemr/blob/master/interface/themes/core/FontAwesome.scss#L29) to the button', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 18, 3, 32, 32, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 394325275, 'comment_body': 'I confused in item 2 add the cancel icon, cancel icon existed in FontAwesome.scss, Do you mean to add a floppy icon? ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 18, 12, 57, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stu01509', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 394538541, 'comment_body': 'sorry, I should of been more clear on this. the goal is to not use the btn classes used in https://github.com/openemr/openemr/blob/master/interface/themes/core/FontAwesome.scss In this case the btn-cancel is using fontawesome icon `\f00d`, which is fa-times So, will look something like: ``` ```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 18, 17, 58, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 394541103, 'comment_body': 'hi @stu01509 , Also, lets incorporate this rec from the styling guide: If you have a group of two or more buttons, be sure to use the btn-group class And will need to fix the merge conflict (then this should be good for the codebase :) )', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 18, 18, 2, 35, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 394641709, 'comment_body': "@bradymiller Now why in the world and since when is it taboo to have standard save,delete and cancel buttons defined. We're going to be chasing our tails if ever we decide to change an icon. Plus why insist a dev have to do that extra work in design. Button design look and feel is part of the theme and should be defined in one place to keep theme consistent through out. Let's not get to carried away here. I agree to not allow custom default button overrides for sizing, spacing etc or even overriding the button itself like theme light does a lot. Btn-save, btn-cancel, btn upload and on are all over core code and doing this is not a coding compromise but just makes sense.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 18, 21, 10, 35, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'sjpadgett', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 394657015, 'comment_body': 'hi @sjpadgett , Just following the styling guide as discussed per @tywrenn . This is definitely the time to figure these things out and what you state is very, very, very reasonable (ie. I am ok with whatever the community decides in this regard), so rec discussing this issue there so we can come to a good centralized conclusion on this asap: https://github.com/openemr/openemr/issues/3160', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 18, 21, 44, 2, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 394699360, 'comment_body': 'hi @sjpadgett and @stu01509 , I posted this issue on the styling issue. The more I think about, the more what @sjpadgett states makes total sense. We can essentially just use the buttons classes simply for icons: https://github.com/openemr/openemr/blob/master/interface/themes/core/FontAwesome.scss#L19-L110', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 18, 23, 36, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 394699467, 'comment_body': "I'm gonna post some rec changes based on above", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 18, 23, 36, 40, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 394699781, 'comment_body': '``` ```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 18, 23, 37, 35, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 394699978, 'comment_body': '``` ```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 18, 23, 38, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 394700092, 'comment_body': '``` ```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 18, 23, 38, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 394700568, 'comment_body': '``` ```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 18, 23, 40, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}]

```
use OpenEMR\Common\Acl\AclMain;
```
Then can check if have access by running the following function:
```
if (AclMain::aclCheckCore('admin', 'super')) {
```

pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 419014906, 'comment_body': "hi @stu01509 , note that `0` is also ok here since it means no time limit. I wouldn't document that since would be confusing, but would not highlight this as incorrect if it is `0`.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 2, 22, 16, 37, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 419031757, 'comment_body': 'OK, Thanks for your explanation.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 3, 1, 34, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stu01509', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 420312121, 'comment_body': "hi @stu01509 , The use of strcmp php function here doesn't look right:
https://www.php.net/manual/en/function.strcmp.php
think it should be:
```
$short_tag_style = strcmp($short_tag, 'Off') ? '' : 'text-danger';
```
(this will also make travis go away)", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 5, 18, 16, 40, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 420414111, 'comment_body': 'Hello @bradymiller 

Thanks for your notice, It is very helpful.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 5, 21, 21, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stu01509', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 420497499, 'comment_body': "to make these statements more readable, lets place parentheses around the conditionals:
```
$short_tag_style = (strcmp($short_tag, 'Off') === 0) ? '' : 'text-danger';
```", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 6, 1, 19, 26, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 420757507, 'comment_body': 'ok, updated commit,', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 6, 12, 39, 48, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stu01509', 'type': 'User'}]

', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 1, 12, 20, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stu01509', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 433629191, 'comment_body': "As long that this isn't a link that is used in multiple scripts (which it is not), ok to just keep the relative link here.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 2, 5, 32, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 434029104, 'comment_body': '@stu01509 Yes', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 2, 16, 54, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'tywrenn', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 434029584, 'comment_body': "@stu01509 That's correct -- unless it doesn't look good when you load it up again", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 2, 16, 55, 33, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'tywrenn', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 434030140, 'comment_body': '@bradymiller @stu01509 for consistency sake, since we use globals a lot, we should be using a global variable for the paths here.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 2, 16, 56, 20, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'tywrenn', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 434031606, 'comment_body': '@stu01509 We should remove it since we are gonna remove a lot of internal styles soon -- yet all styles that were in here should be matched with BS4 except the unnecessary ones.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 2, 16, 58, 37, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'tywrenn', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 434035723, 'comment_body': "Crappppppppppp --- @stu01509 go to `interface/themes/oe-bootstrap.scss` and remove the `input[type=checkbox], input[type=radio]` line that incorporates this and test the form elements out globally - I should've removed this line. Also remove the `.form-group` line as well as this shouldn't have existed.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 2, 17, 5, 44, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'tywrenn', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 434850381, 'comment_body': '@tywrenn @stu01509 ,
To change this to absolute path, can use:
```
<link rel="stylesheet" href="<?php echo $GLOBALS['rootdir']; ?>/forms/<?php echo $form_folder; ?>/css/style.css" type="text/css">
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 3, 20, 59, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 435206732, 'comment_body': "Hello @bradymiller  and @tywrenn

", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 4, 12, 14, 53, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stu01509', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 436057601, 'comment_body': "If it doesn't go to anything you might as well remove it", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 5, 17, 21, 2, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'tywrenn', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 436059151, 'comment_body': 'What does this `drugsonly` class do?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 5, 17, 24, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'tywrenn', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 436060407, 'comment_body': 'Inputs that have the type of "submit" should stay as inputs and not be turned into buttons. pr_title: feat: add the bootstrap style and remove outdated code
pr_body:
<!--
(Thanks for sending a pull request!
-->

<!-- Add the issue number that is fixed by this PR (In the form Fixes #123) -->


#### Short description of what this resolves:
- Change to the Bootstrap datatables and button style.
- Remove outdated code.

Before:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/83467537-c5ea0580-a4ac-11ea-907c-d0025c125701.png)

After:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/83467516-b1a60880-a4ac-11ea-8c80-9fb9adad99c0.png)
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 433627205, 'comment_body': "Something I've noted in other places in the codebase when bringing in bs into datatables, is that still need to keep the `datatables-dt` there.
```
<?php Header::setupHeader(['opener', 'datatables', 'datatables-dt', 'datatables-bs', 'datatables-colreorder']); ?>
```", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 2, 5, 25, 6, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 433627604, 'comment_body': 'missing `</button>`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 2, 5, 26, 34, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 433640335, 'comment_body': "also please don't get in the habit of translating button value attr unless value is going to be the buttons ui name. One or the other. Say a button is going to be a submit button and you translate spanish value attr which may be used in the submit conditional value which is in english then they won't match. 
I see this often enough to point it out again.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 2, 6, 8, 35, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'sjpadgett', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 433650414, 'comment_body': "This can be a bit murky since depends on the mechanism of the input. At this point, @stu01509 is simply keeping the value there as is in order to not break whatever the mechanism was. For example, submit buttons need to keep the value (generally just needs to be anything, but you don't know for sure unless look at the script that catches the $_REQUEST). There was time when a significant part of OpenEMR actually used the value when catching variables, which broke horribly on translations. In those cases, the name attribute was then used instead, so the translated value was not used (ie. value could be anything) or even in some cases as I recall the script catching the $_REQUEST would also look for a translated value. Since it's not straightforward and case specific and the goal is super high throughput, it seems ok to just keep the value's as is, which will also avoid bugs since it does not change behavior. Agree that we definitely should not carry over this process in new scripts.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 2, 6, 36, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 433666888, 'comment_body': "I'm to tired to debate the point. It's enough to say that it's a bad habit. ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 2, 7, 14, 7, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'sjpadgett', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 433668632, 'comment_body': "I also agree it's a really bad habit, and will ban the original author (whomever and wherever you are) from OpenEMR for 1 minute.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 2, 7, 17, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 433670697, 'comment_body': 'ahh, I feel so much better now!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 2, 7, 21, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'sjpadgett', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 433672103, 'comment_body': 'The ban is over (whomever and wherever you are). If it makes you feel better, I probably left  very large dents in the walls with my head wherever I lived during the translation effort that got to deal with translated values.

![tenor (23)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/278968/83492303-ef347280-a467-11ea-982e-104924c4087d.gif)
', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 2, 7, 24, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 433675652, 'comment_body': "I get it. I think you guys did a great job on translations. I don't know how it could be any easier to use.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 2, 7, 31, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'sjpadgett', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 433759791, 'comment_body': 'OK, Updated the commit.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 2, 9, 56, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stu01509', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 433768080, 'comment_body': 'Thanks for the @bradymiller sir explanation, At first I also removed the button value attribute, but never think of it will break submit form data. If we will refactor it may a big plan and need a lot of tests.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 2, 10, 11, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stu01509', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 433769835, 'comment_body': 'Hello @bradymiller and @tywrenn 

Just asking, such as ` ` and `\n` character, Are they can remove?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 2, 10, 15, 14, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stu01509', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 434026335, 'comment_body': "Since this is php, do not remove the `\n` character as this is used to escape new lines in php. As far as ` ` goes, this is used to add some space between characters in html. Since Bootstrap usually takes care of this (and you can also take care of this through padding and just adding a space between text), let's try removing the ` ` character. I recommend after removing it though to make sure this doesn't change the format of the HTML code and to adjust accordingly.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 2, 16, 50, 27, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'tywrenn', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 434028456, 'comment_body': '@sjpadgett @bradymiller @stu01509 The value attribute of button elements (even though in some cases breaks code) is a sin and should be burned at the steak. The value of buttons is what resides inside the buttons making the value attribute useless.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 2, 16, 53, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'tywrenn', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 434050315, 'comment_body': 'Yes, agreed in theory. But it will break code in many cases, not just some.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 2, 17, 30, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 436388284, 'comment_body': 'Should be surrounded by a "table-responsive" div', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 7, 18, 14, 2, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'tywrenn', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 436402790, 'comment_body': 'Done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 7, 21, 18, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stu01509', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: Refactor: refine the message section pages
pr_body:
<!--
(Thanks for sending a pull request!
-->

<!-- Add the issue number that is fixed by this PR (In the form Fixes #123) -->


#### Short description of what this resolves:
- Remove the nested grid system.
- Remove outdated and unnecessary code.
- Adjust the form-group style.
- Fix the form and table responsive overflow issue.
- Fix the button style and broken icon.

If not, why we need to remove all of the `row` class, Is it not break the grid system?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 26, 21, 55, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stu01509', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 446429404, 'comment_body': "I know we can use the bootstrap utils class, but this issue cause by datatables style.

", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 26, 22, 0, 34, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stu01509', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 446452950, 'comment_body': 'Change line 64 where the `loading` variable is to a BS4 spinner
[https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.5/components/spinners/](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.5/components/spinners/)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 26, 23, 41, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'tywrenn', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 446454002, 'comment_body': "The col-12 really does no harm in terms of coding yet it is a legacy term that shouldn't really be used unless you are making multiple col's. [{'comment_id': 456868008, 'comment_body': 'Hello @bradymiller  and @tywrenn 

Does OpenEMR have any guide to limit the use of the echo to render the HTML?

Such as this PR, the page consists of use echo to render the HTML view, but it caused hard to refine and maintain the HTML  code, So I would like to ask you, should I refactor to pure HTML?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 19, 6, 34, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stu01509', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 456936433, 'comment_body': "We don't. Since both ways work (yet might impact execution time if you use echo), I generally would allow both methods. If you want to put the extra work to converting it to HTML with the translations echoing only you can do that but there really is no difference.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 19, 17, 54, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'tywrenn', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 456949760, 'comment_body': 'Okay, thanks for your explanation. I will convert a part of the echo into HTML.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 19, 20, 6, 33, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stu01509', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 460262443, 'comment_body': 'Semicolon after every xlt and function call', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 20, 3, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'tywrenn', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 460541076, 'comment_body': "Hi @tywrenn

pr_body:
Refine the dashboard pages.

<!--
(Thanks for sending a pull request!
-->

<!-- Add the issue number that is fixed by this PR (In the form Fixes #123) -->

#### Short description of what this resolves:
- Refine the dashboard report, transactions, issues, ledger, and external data pages.
- Remove outdated code, inline-style.
- Adjust the Bootstrap grid, form, and table style.


##### Report section
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/89102584-6d4bd000-d43d-11ea-9e33-89bf6ca5163b.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/89102592-848abd80-d43d-11ea-9ccc-aef609b4440c.png)


##### Transactions section
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/89102618-a6844000-d43d-11ea-9a66-7cb8c7a8fdab.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/89102630-be5bc400-d43d-11ea-91ec-7a5959a63f30.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/89186000-be8ac980-d5cd-11ea-8bb7-89398fea9783.png)

##### Issuess section
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/89102636-ddf2ec80-d43d-11ea-9566-480a12cc1865.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/89102642-eba87200-d43d-11ea-83bf-522a1b18694c.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/89186023-ccd8e580-d5cd-11ea-8154-4537c1931d81.png)

##### Ledger section
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/89186046-d6fae400-d5cd-11ea-899e-d0746820b392.png)

pr_title: Refactor: refine all of the patient visit forms.
pr_body:
Refine all of the patient visit forms. except for the eye exam.

<!-- Add the issue number that is fixed by this PR (In the form Fixes #123) -->

#### Short description of what this resolves:
- Adjust the code format.
- Adjust the button color and icon.
- Fix CSS media query miss brackets.
- Remove outdated code and inline-style.
- Adjust the bootstrap form and grid style.

#### Care Plan Form:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/89645020-8fd16380-d8eb-11ea-8e5e-3dfd39f38a20.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/89645046-99f36200-d8eb-11ea-919c-5f6a45e68d38.png)

#### Clinical Instructions Form:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/89645078-a8417e00-d8eb-11ea-927e-106040c7db3e.png)

#### Functional and Cognitive Status Form:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/89645143-cc04c400-d8eb-11ea-80cf-d08145d3797f.png)

#### Observation Form:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/89645181-dc1ca380-d8eb-11ea-9b1c-088b2509a6c5.png)

#### Review Of Systems Form:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/89712125-63881680-d9c1-11ea-9a34-8c5103dda8f8.png)

#### Review of Systems Checks Form:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/89645285-079f8e00-d8ec-11ea-98d3-adb4e1718818.png)

#### SOAP Form:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/89645308-19813100-d8ec-11ea-9ef8-008ad42d6a40.png)

#### Dictation Form:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/89645392-49303900-d8ec-11ea-8f36-f5e015d6a6e6.png)

#### Vitals Form:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/89645456-66fd9e00-d8ec-11ea-8fcd-658a51c401a2.png)

#### Miscellaneous Billing Options for HCFA-1500 Form:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/89710413-6977fa80-d9b5-11ea-95ec-87a47665fb89.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/278968/91369007-66f01000-e7bf-11ea-82bc-66b1fe44f491.png)

', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 27, 0, 14, 14, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 478497414, 'comment_body': 'Hi @bradymiller 

So, should I add the link to back to Dashboard page? like this?
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/91461184-44dbb800-e8bb-11ea-89b5-5e9fe1d52d86.png)
', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 27, 15, 16, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stu01509', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 478837598, 'comment_body': 'hi @stu01509 ,

Note that the vitals script is run in 2 different contexts.

1. Context One. When run from the Patient Demographics screen when click `Trend` button in the vitals section. In this case the above line should show an icon, however I am betting the fontawesome upgrade we did awhile ago broke that icon.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/278968/91524525-4b1a6600-e8b4-11ea-8275-2802412611ed.png)


2. Context Two. Is how the form is normally run from the encounter gui. And in this case the link/icon is hidden (since do not want user going back to the patient summary screen in that context).

-brady
', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 28, 5, 26, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479934624, 'comment_body': 'Look like in merge, that the following sections got duplicated:
Gastrointestinal
Genitourinary
Musculoskeletal
Endocrine
Additional Notes', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 31, 7, 1, 3, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479936646, 'comment_body': 'couple lines below, looks like lost 2 lines of updated code in merge that should look like:
```
                            <button type="submit" class="btn btn-primary btn-save editonly" name="Submit" value=''>{xlt t="Save"}</button>
                            <button type="button" class="btn btn-secondary btn-cancel editonly" id="cancel" value=''>{xlt t="Cancel"}</button>
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 31, 7, 5, 51, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479962354, 'comment_body': '(dang, that was a tough merge :) ; i just went through the merge also to confirm it).

Just 2 more changes needed in this script:
```
<div class="btn-group oe-opt-btn-group-pinch" role="group">
```
to
```
<div class="btn-group" role="group">
```
and then
```
<button type="button" class="btn btn-secondary btn-cancel oe-opt-btn-separate-left" onclick="top.restoreSession(); parent.closeTab(window.name, false);"><?php echo xlt('Cancel');?></button>
```
to 
```
<button type="button" class="btn btn-secondary btn-cancel" onclick="top.restoreSession(); parent.closeTab(window.name, false);"><?php echo xlt('Cancel');?></button>
```

Then this PR will be ready for codebase.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 31, 7, 59, 55, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'bradymiller', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479964058, 'comment_body': 'Update the commit.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 31, 8, 3, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'stu01509', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: Refactor: refine the fee sheet, new encounter form, procedure order pages.
pr_body:
Refine the fee sheet, new encounter form, procedure order pages.

<!--
(Thanks for sending a pull request!
-->

<!-- Add the issue number that is fixed by this PR (In the form Fixes #123) -->
Fixes #

#### Short description of what this resolves:
- Remove outdated code, comment, and inline-style.
- Adjust the bootstrap form class.

### Fee Sheet:

<!--
(Thanks for sending a pull request!

Refine the fee section pages.
<!-- Add the issue number that is fixed by this PR (In the form Fixes #123) -->
Fixes #

#### Short description of what this resolves:

- Align the field title to the input field.

<!--
(Thanks for sending a pull request!
-->
Remove unnecessary `oe` classes.

<!-- Add the issue number that is fixed by this PR (In the form Fixes #123) -->

#### Short description of what this resolves:
In this PR,  remove the 
- oe-opt-btn-separate-left
- oe-opt-btn-group-pinch
- btn-group-pinch
- btn-separate-left

And convert the `oe-text-to-right`, `oe-text-to-left` to Bootstrap classes
- text-left
- text-right

pr_body:
In this PR, I refine the Providers, Configure, Load Compendium, Pending Review, Patient Results, Batch Results, Electronic Reports, and Lab Documents pages.

<!-- Add the issue number that is fixed by this PR (In the form Fixes #123) -->

#### Short description of what this resolves:
- Remove outdated code and inline-style.
- Convert the CSS to bootstrap classes.
- Adjust the bootstrap grid system.

##### Procedure > Providers:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/90957047-0bbbd600-e4be-11ea-959f-caaf7f6c7aa9.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/90957055-15453e00-e4be-11ea-8710-f8121e779d98.png)

##### Procedure > Configuration:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/90957066-268e4a80-e4be-11ea-8657-d73badab432e.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/90957082-43c31900-e4be-11ea-88cd-533bca00d725.png)

##### Procedure > Load Compendium:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/90957102-5ccbca00-e4be-11ea-931e-ceb28f7f5356.png)

##### Procedure >  Pending Review & Procedure > Patient Results & Procedure > Batch Results:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/90957115-6d7c4000-e4be-11ea-85e3-000e3555e378.png)

##### Procedure > Electronic Reports:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/90957160-b633f900-e4be-11ea-8de7-34b632346a62.png)

##### Procedure > Lab Documents:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22230889/90957169-c5b34200-e4be-11ea-8ef5-3ff01349cf23.png)
